image.altText: Mark Carney standing behind a podium delivering a speech in front of the Canadian flag

props.synopsis: For months, senior officials have been discussing exporting Australia's world-leading JORN radar technology to the United States, but after Donald Trump's return to the White House, Canada saw an opportunity and leapt.

title.children: Australia's 'biggest defence export' was meant for the US first, but Canada snuck past Trump

image.altText: A woman surrounded by men wearing sunglasses and hoodies

props.synopsis: Ahmad Rashad Nadir, 27 and Sarah Abu Lebdeh, 26, were charged over a video where they allegedly made threats to Israeli patients.

title.children: Sydney nurse shielded by men in hoodies leaving first court appearance

image.altText: Trump rests his fingertips together at his desk in the Oval Office

props.synopsis: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin are both hailing their phone call as a significant step towards peace in Ukraine. That doesn't mean it was.

title.children: Trump needed a deal out of his call with Putin. He got almost nothing

image.altText: A man in a suit puts his arm on a man in judge's robes

props.synopsis: US Chief Justice John Roberts rebukes President Donald Trump for calling for the impeachment of a federal judge, saying it is "not an appropriate response to disagreement concerning a judicial decision".

title.children: US chief justice pushes back on Trump's call to impeach federal judge

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: The ACT Integrity Commission has found the man who led the Board of Inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann engaged in "serious corrupt conduct".

title.children: 'Serious corrupt conduct': Findings from inquiry into Walter Sofronoff released

image.altText: Dutton smiles, sitting in parliament with his arms crossed

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton's decision to float the idea of holding a national vote on criminal dual citizens has Liberal MPs privately questioning the Coalition's messaging and strategy.

title.children: Coalition MPs told to hose down Dutton's dual national referendum idea

image.altText: murder victim Lilie James in a car wearing a yellow top smiles as she takes a selfie

props.synopsis: Lilie James was smiling and talking to her killer moments before her death with "no indication" of what he was going to do, an inquest has heard.

title.children: CCTV of Lilie James moments before her murder 'not easy to watch'

image.altText: Astronauts landing

props.synopsis: NASA'S SpaceX Crew-9, including astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, are safely back on Earth after a long-awaited journey home.

title.children: NASA praises 'resilient' astronauts after nine months in space

image.altText: Richard White stands in front of office windows, with rooftops and trees visible behind him

props.synopsis: WiseTech co-founder and executive chair Richard White accepts the findings of a board review into his conduct and will remain in his current role, after a tumultuous period for the software firm.

title.children: WiseTech founder Richard White accepts ‘seriousness of his actions’

image.altText: A white-haired man wearing a suit looks sideways

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu says the fighting will continue until his country achieves its goals of destroying Hamas and freeing all hostages held by the militant group.

title.children: Israeli PM vows to destroy Hamas after resuming air strikes in Gaza

image.altText: A little girl on the beach wearing a cap and pink top

props.synopsis: The NT coroner is examining a toddler's "undetermined" cause of death after a medical incident at a childcare centre in Darwin's rural area, about 18 months after she was found unresponsive by staff.

title.children: Toddler's death after childcare medical incident examined by coroner

image.altText: A crowd fills a town hall for a protest meeting.

props.synopsis: One north-east Victorian town is battling a renewable energy project while its neighbour has plans to go totally green, fuelling policy division ahead of the election.

title.children: Victorian town pledges to take fight against battery storage to election

image.altText: spry

props.synopsis: The Trump administration has declassified documents revealing the CIA investigated anonymous calls made to the US embassy in Canberra before and after president John F Kennedy's assassination.

title.children: ASIO wanted Canberra link to JFK murder probe kept secret

image.altText: US gymnast Jordan Chiles, in profile, holds up her Paris Olympics bronze medal and looks at it.

props.synopsis: Jordan Chiles says she still has the bronze medal she was awarded after the women's floor routine at the Paris Olympics despite an appeal bumping her down to fifth spot.

title.children: US gymnast who finished fifth still has bronze medal from Paris Olympics

image.altText: Shannon Cox with a football in his hand.

props.synopsis: Former Collingwood player Shannon Cox pleads guilty in a Perth court to manslaughter over the crash in WA's outback in which two women, aged in their 80s, both died.

title.children: Former AFL player Shannon Cox admits killing women in car crash

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

props.synopsis: Once as high as 60 cents per kilowatt hour, solar feed-in tariffs are now as low as just a few cents for some. While 4 million households have rooftop solar, home battery storage systems sit at around 320,000 — but take-up has surged as the economics improve.

title.children: 'It's a scam': As solar feed-in tariffs plunge, battery demand surges

image.altText: Two signes outside a shop that read "MYER"

props.synopsis: Myer's profit dropped nearly 40 per cent in the first half of the financial year. A fall on Wall Street has sent Australian stocks lower, as investors exercise caution ahead of a monetary policy decision from the Federal Reserve. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Myer profit tumbles as department store hit by distribution issues

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Bank of Japan leaves interest rates on hold
WiseTech shares steady after review into Richard White's conduct
ASX flat after recovering from earlier dip

image.altText: A Moree police officer playing goaltender at the PCYC hall

props.synopsis: NSW Police say dozens of young "ringleaders" committing violent crimes in the state's north and west will be the target of new rapid-response units.

title.children: 100 young 'ringleaders' targeted by police in youth crime crackdown

image.altText: A woman in an apron with red hair tied back and bright blue eyes looks solemnly into camera behind a cafe counter.

props.synopsis: With a record number of hospitality sector closures last month, small businesses are fighting to find ways to keep customers coming through their doors.

title.children: Customers snub cafes, restaurants as spending tightens

image.altText: A boy in a pink short with his arm around another boy in a dark jacket.

props.synopsis: Emergency service crews were called to John Renshaw Drive at Black Hill, north-west of Newcastle, where a Holden Commodore and a Ford utility had collided.

title.children: Mother says son had just picked up his first car before fatal crash

image.altText: Ambulance

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands more patients are leaving NSW emergency departments before getting treatment compared with before the pandemic, new data shows.

title.children: Thousands leaving NSW emergency departments before treatment

image.altText: An orange wave buoy rider in the ocean, words keep clean visible.

props.synopsis: It's been seven months since the Cape du Couedic wave buoy started malfunctioning off Kangaroo Island, with the BOM blaming supply issues in Canada for delays to a replacement.

title.children: No fix in sight for broken Bureau of Meteorology wave buoy

image.altText: A close-up of a woman's hands, with fingernails painted blue, pink and white.

props.synopsis: Carly loved dressing as a girl from an early age and was preparing to start puberty blockers when the Queensland government banned her and hundreds of others from receiving free treatment. Her mother is furious at politicians for "interfering" in Carly's healthcare.

title.children: 'I don't want to grow a beard': Trans girl reacts to hormone ban

image.altText: Adam Bandt in Mural Hall

props.synopsis: As you would expect in the nation's current cheesed-off state of mind, all three major party leaders enjoyed sub-zero popularity among survey respondents. Everyone hates everything right now, especially if it's anywhere near politics. But it was surprising news for the Greens leader.

title.children: Sub-zero popularity aside, many voters don't even recognise this leader

image.altText: A woman stands outside a gate

props.synopsis: Families and former workers say staffing ratios and profits are jeopardising good care at South Australian childcare centres, as data shows serious incidents are on the rise.

title.children: Former childcare educator speaks out over concerns with the sector

image.altText: A pencil holder of coloured pencils sits in front of pieces of paper with childrens' finger paintings.

props.synopsis: As the public outcry from educators and parents intensifies in the wake of the Four Corners investigation into Australia's broken childcare system, the reluctance of senior politicians responsible for overseeing the sector to do something to fix it is striking.

title.children: As anger intensifies, politicians are reluctant to take action on childcare fails

image.altText: Victoria Police badge on an officer's arm.

props.synopsis: A regional Victorian mayor says reports of vigilantism in a small town are "terrifying" some residents after a man allegedly heavily beat a young teenager.

title.children: Police investigate reports petrol bomb thrown at teen in vigilante attack

image.altText: A solid gold toilet sculpture

props.synopsis: The 18-carat solid-gold toilet was on display for just two days at an English palace before it was stolen under the cover of darkness.

title.children: Two men found guilty over multi-million-dollar gold toilet heist

image.altText: A young man with brown hair stands in front of a white wall with some scaffolding attached, holding plans for a deck

props.synopsis: Construction workers are calling on the ACT government to speed up the approval process for development applications amid an ongoing housing crisis.

title.children: Waiting months for approval for a deck, tradies say change is needed

image.altText: A middle aged woman with brown hair sitting at a table with a small dog

props.synopsis: As data shows thousands of over-65s are winding up in hospital with oral health issues, the Australian Dental Association is calling for a scheme that gives seniors access to free dental work.

title.children: Dentists want a free oral health plan for seniors as hospitalisations surge

image.altText: Vladimir Putin, waring a suit and tie and making a hand gesture, pictured in front of a blue background

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin rejects Donald Trump's proposal for an immediate full ceasefire in Ukraine, but tells the US president he will pause attacks on energy infrastructure while talks on a permanent truce take place.

title.children: Putin agrees to halt energy infrastructure strikes, tells Trump to end Ukraine aid

image.altText: Barbie Ferreira and John Leguizamo sit across a table from each other in a diner.

props.synopsis: When Tracie Laymon tried to track down her estranged father, the man she found wasn't actually her dad, but he became the father figure she always yearned for. So, she made a movie about it.

title.children: Tracie was looking for her dad on Facebook but found something better

image.altText: Cathrine Mupangure takes a selfie

props.synopsis: Growing up as a neurotypical woman of colour in a white country, there is not a lot of wiggle room to be different. Having a disability makes that 10 times harder.

title.children: I was seen as lazy growing up. A diagnosis in my 20s explained a lot
